title: Barrazas, Carolina, Puerto Rico
text:
Barrazas is a <a href="Barrios%20of%20Puerto%20Rico">barrio</a> in the municipality of <a href="Carolina%2C%20Puerto%20Rico">Carolina, Puerto Rico</a>. Its population in 2010 was 4,301.
History.
Puerto Rico was ceded by <a href="Spain">Spain</a> in the aftermath of the <a href="Spanish%E2%80%93American%20War">Spanish–American War</a> under the terms of the <a href="Treaty%20of%20Paris%20of%201898">Treaty of Paris of 1898</a> and became an <a href="Insular%20area">unincorporated territory of the United States</a>. In 1899, the <a href="United%20States%20Department%20of%20War">United States Department of War</a> conducted a <a href="census">census</a> of Puerto Rico finding that the population of Borrasa Bajo barrio was 764 and Borrasa Alta barrio was 889.
